storylines.name: Tis
storylines.description: A stage 0 tumor is a non-invasive carcinoma in situ (Cis/Tis). The neighboring lymph nodes are not affected (N0). There are also no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T1N0M0
storylines.description: In stage I, the tumor is no larger than 2 cm (T1). The neighboring lymph nodes are not affected (N0, stage IA) or they are so-called micrometastases (< 2 mm, N1mi, stage IB). There are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T0N1M0
storylines.description: There is no detectable tumor (T0), but the disease has already affected individual lymph nodes in the armpit (N1). There are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T1N1M0
storylines.description: The tumor is up to 2 cm in size (T1), and individual lymph nodes in the armpit have already been affected (N1). There are no distant paltases (M0).

storylines.name: T2N0M0
storylines.description: If the tumor is between 2 and 5 cm in size (T2), the disease is classified as stage IIA even without involvement of lymph nodes (N0) or distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T2N1M0
storylines.description: The tumor is larger than 2 cm, but no more than 5 cm in size (T2). The disease has already affected individual lymph nodes in the armpit (N1). There are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T3N0M0
storylines.description: If the tumor is larger than 5 cm (T3), the disease is classified as stage IIB even without involvement of lymph nodes (N0) or distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T0N2M0
storylines.description: There is no detectable tumor (T0), but lymph nodes in the armpit or near the breast are increasingly affected by cancer (N2). There are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T1N2M0
storylines.description: The tumor has a maximum size of 2 cm (T1) and the cancer has increasingly affected lymph nodes in the armpit or near the breast (N2). There are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T2N2M0
storylines.description: The tumor is 2 - 5 cm in size (T2) and lymph nodes in the armpit or near the breast are increasingly affected by cancer (N2). There are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T3N1M0
storylines.description: The tumor is larger than 5 cm (T3). However, only a few surrounding lymph nodes are affected (N1). There are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T3N2M0
storylines.description: The tumor is larger than 5 cm (T3). Lymph nodes in the armpit or near the breast are also increasingly affected (N2). There are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T4N0M0
storylines.description: T4 means that the tumor has already spread to the chest wall or skin. However, lymph nodes are not affected (N0) and distant metastases cannot be detected (M0).

storylines.name: T4N1M0
storylines.description: The tumor has affected the chest wall or skin (T4), and individual surrounding lymph nodes have also been affected (N1). However, there are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T4N2M0
storylines.description: The tumor has affected the chest wall or skin (T4), and lymph nodes in the armpit or near the breast have also been increasingly affected (N2). However, there are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T0N3M0
storylines.description: There is no detectable tumor (T0), but many lymph nodes in the armpit, near the breast or along the internal thoracic artery are affected by cancer (N3). There are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T1N3M0
storylines.description: The tumor is a maximum of 2 cm in size (T1). Many lymph nodes in the armpit, near the breast or along the internal thoracic artery are affected by cancer (N3). However, there are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T2N3M0
storylines.description: The tumor is 2 - 5 cm in size (T2) and many lymph nodes in the armpit, near the breast or along the internal thoracic artery are affected by cancer (N3). There are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T3N3M0
storylines.description: The tumor is larger than 5 cm (T3), and many lymph nodes in the armpit, near the breast or along the internal thoracic artery are affected by cancer (N3). There are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: T4N3M0
storylines.description: The tumor has affected the chest wall or skin (T4), and many lymph nodes in the armpit, near the breast or along the internal thoracic artery are affected (N3). There are no distant metastases (M0).

storylines.name: every T;every N;M1
storylines.description: As soon as distant metastases are present (M1), the disease is assigned to stage IV. The tumor itself can be of any size (T1-T4) or undetectable (T0). Likewise, the lymph nodes in the armpit, near the chest or along the internal thoracic artery may be affected (N1-N3) or not (N0).

storylines.name: every T;every N;M1bra
storylines.description: If distant metastases are present (M1/M1bra), the disease is classified as stage IV. The addition “bra” means that they are located in the brain. The tumor itself can be of any size (T1-T4) or undetectable (T0). Likewise, the lymph nodes in the armpit, near the chest or along the internal thoracic artery may be affected (N1-N3) or not (N0).
